My dad and I are here all the time!! Haha!! I would highly recommend this to all my family and friends to visit Nanay Gloria whenever you are in Vegas!! Staff members are there to assist you if you don't know the dishes or are new to the restaurant. Just make sure you finish whatever you get because we hate wasting food! Lol enjoy!! Kain na!!!

Our family enjoyed our breakfast here at Nanay Gloria. During their breakfast hours, you have the option to eat a buffet for a fantastic price. Selections of food items were plenty and arrived fresh almost every hour we were there. Staff was friendly and always asked if we needed help. Although we did not have the chance to visit the larger restaurant, this place was great for what it was worth.

Nanay Gloria's serves authentic Filipino dishes buffet-style. What you should expect from here is an abundance of food that sticks close to traditional Filipino culture. The food reminds me of the things made by your titas or lolas. I'm the type of person who really likes eating at places like this because it reminds me of the Filipino home cooking from my family that I truly miss.

They have two rooms: a room with the buffet line and tables with chairs and the other room with booths and a water dispenser. They did not have a soda fountain, so all the drinks have to be purchased from their mini-market section next to the register. 

All the staple dishes are there: kaldereta, kare-kare, sisig, fried bangus, etc. I don't think they have a set menu, either. So you might not see some of the things I listed, but I'm pretty sure the popularly requested ones are always put out. Try their chicken tinola or the chicken adobo if you just want a common cultural dish. I was skeptical about their sisig at first, but when you try it I'm pretty sure it'll wow your tastebuds like it did mine. 

If you have an appreciation for true Filipino cooking, then this is the place for you. Don't expect anything but the full cultural flavor from the Philippines.

I've been here a couple of time and more then a few time for their lumpia. Huge portion for a nice amount of lumpias . The food is good and it's a buffet style like place tho you can order plates as well.

I rate this place -0 no stars 
waited for the lady Patiently to finish off the customer  in front of me.. but took long been standing for about good 7 min .. I like to Observe my surrounding and I can't help it the lady / cashier take money and cards for payment she just got done with the couple in front of me. and than she spoke FILIPINO to but I didn't respond cause I didn't know what she was saying.. so I said to go .. so the lady in the back of me spoke FILIPINO and she than took her order and and SKIPPED me .. I than asked the lady ARE YOU GONNA CHANGE Your GLOVES YOU TOUCHED MONEY AND CREDIT CARDS.. than she mumbled and I said HELL NO.. NOPE NOT EATING HERE... GOING SOMEWHERE ELES.. COME ON  USE YOUR BRIAN UR DEALING WITH FOOD ...   GIRL BYE ---I GIVE NOOOO STARS

This place was meh for me, atmosphere-wise. Very hole-in-the-wall, self-service-buffet plain. Cheap chairs and tables, that sort of thing. 

But the food was flavorful- I liked everything I tried (except the Ube cake). I wish the foods were labeled- I had no idea what I was eating. If there were labels, I don't remember seeing them. Luckily, I went with friends who could identify most of the dishes. 

This is the type of place I would prefer to visit to fill up containers with food that I would then take home to eat.

For all of you hard core first generation filipinos that grew up on your mom's home cooked meals that you crave and cannot get anywhere unless you decide you want to cook for two hours...come to Nanay Gloria's!  (Mama Gloria's)

This place is a filipino buffet...just the way things are served at my family 'get-togethers';  there is a lot of food, it's always buffet style because we don't limit the food that's given to company...ever, and you cannot stop eating because the food is so good!

Seriously!  The food here is cooked as if I were at my mom's house and I lifted the pot lids to see what was cooking.  My mom always made food from fresh ingredients, never cooked from a recipe.

This next part may sound foreign and yeah, it is. I won't try to explain what these dishes are, just look at the picture! 

At this buffet, there is tinapa, pancit, pakbet, lichon paksiw, sago, and halo-halo.  You may have had to acquire a taste to these dishes to appreciate them, but nonetheless it's worth trying if you've never had filipino food. 

Wow!  I'm having visions of big spoons and forks hung over the dining table with a portrait of the last supper in black velvet texture!

Oh, and never mind the atmosphere - it's a dive and it's great!  You'll get the latest episode of filipino soap operas and can read the latest filipino newspaper that you see the same people in all the time.

$7 all you can eat buffet!  You can also take-out by pints and quarts at very reasonable prices.

Mabuhay!

Hubby and I ... love .. Filipino food.  I grew up eating it back home on Guam...my friends shared what they brought from home, etc.  So we make it a priority to have some almost every time we're out here in Vegas.  This time around, we had a couple Filipino friends with us who were more than happy to get some "food" with us since they live in the Pacific Northwest.

We settled on Nanay because of good ratings, it's AYCE and well-priced.  For the most part, it was very much worth it.  The offerings were very broad (though, to be fair, there were a few dishes that got old because of low turnover).

Standouts:  kare kare, miswa, bihon, sisig and dinuguan.  Pinakbet was good too but I added more bagoong to it.  I have to say - I'm glad it was AYCE because I (and my companions as well) destroyed the kare kare.  They probably saw a big dip in their kare kare stash when we were there.

They had an obligatory fruit section - I only ate the grapes, came across some mushy ones.

The wide variety was definitely a plus.  We didn't really encounter any service other than the stoic old man who sits near the restrooms and comes by to collect your tray every once in a while.

I can definitely see us coming back at some point.  Yum!

This is a Fat Man's wet dream! Seriously, for a very reasonable price ALL YOU CAN EAT Filipino food! Heaven! Maybe not the best place to visit if you're trying to watch your waistline, but otherwise you can not go wrong here!

Everything you need, to include lechon, is in the food line, finished off with self serve rice. And like any good buffet, go back for as many trips as you like. Like I wrote though, if you have self control issues like I do, and you're on a diet, do NOT go here! Otherwise enjoy! It's truly a small piece of Filipino heaven.

My only complaints are limited seating and it's mainly a lunch place, so no late night grub runs can be made. Hence the 4 stars opposed to 5. It's really a 4.5 rating, though. 

ALBUQUERQUE, we need a place like this!

It was my first time at this place and I was very impressed by the variety of Filipino food that they serve.  How we got to this place was like destiny.  We were suppose to have breakfast in another place but that restaurant was still closed. when we took uber the driver recommended Nanay Gloria. 
This place is heaven. So many choices. It is an all you can eat/ whatever your heart desires kind of place- EXCELLENT HOME COOKING!!!!!
Nanay Gloria is a success story.
I challenge all of you to find out for yourselves to check out this place when you are in the Chinatown of Las Vegas.

I saw this place when I was leaving the restaurant next door. I got 2 empanadas to go and they were delish!!

Can't comment on the buffet except that everyone there seemed to be enjoying it. I'll be back to try it.
My family eats here all the time. The service is great and the food is consistently good, unlike other buffets. Writing this review is making me hungry, probably will get lunch there today.
Great food, cheap prices and a clean place to eat.  Will be back!
Excellent value for the price. Probably the best way to introduce Filipino food to people. The selection is big and the price can't be beat....

This place is only for Filipinos who are too lazy cook for themselves and are willing to eat dirt as long as it is called Filipino. Perhaps I am just white guy spoiled by a Filipina wife who cooks better than anyone on the planet, but I tried only the Nanay Gloria dishes that my wife cooks at home for comparison and I came very close to puking on the table. So, if someone invites you to this restaurant, they are either trying to kill you or prove that they hate you. Run, run fast and far before eating at Nanay Gloria's restaurant.

My go-to place when I'm craving for comfort food. The price is very affordable for all you can eat Filipino food. I've been here about 3x now and I love it! 

There's a lot of food options to choose from. I love that they have a wide range of foods from soups, Adobo, pancit, etc... Their karekare is my all time fave! I don't think it's oily or lack any flavor. Everything is always on point. 
I always leave feeling happy and full.

Ugh I seriously hate writing bad reviews for places I used to love. I went here for lunch on a Saturday and the buffet was basically naked! The kare kare only had a spoonful of food, which was cold! The sinigang was filled but tasted like water! I mean come on add some mama sita it won't make you guys bankrupt! The pancit was ROTTEN! I took one bite and I knew I was going to get food poisoning! The rice was HARD! It's obvious that they served yesterdays food! Not to mention while they were BBQing the restaurant turned super smokey! I am guessing that they don't have an exhaust hood! By the time I left I smelt like burnt BBQ! Oh and I guess the reason for all this is because the cook is sick! Ok while I wish him/her well, I do think that they should hire someone who knows how to cook just in case something happens! It's just wrong to only have one cook and serve rotten food when he's gone!

Every dish I tried at Nanay Gloria's was extremely good. Since I tasted just about everything and I do not know names of many of the dishes, I am not going to review each one. Every dish was equally tasty. Everything tastes homemade. YUMMY!!!

I think this place has became my go to restaurant for Filipino food in Las Vegas. I would suggest anyone to give it a try. I promise you will not be disappointed. 

Did I forget to mention? It is a buffet!!! For two people, I paid $15.06. What a deal?!?!

Thank god I found a Filipino restaurant I love!

Not the best place for Filipino food. The staff kind of ignores you when your are looking at the selection at the buffet. The serving bowls are very tiny and when I Asked for one of larger take out bowls for my soup, I got scuffed at and told to use the tiny bowls. After I got my food and sat down, the food I selected was luke warm at best, make you wonder at what the temperature the steam table is set at or if it is working properly at all. At the end I went to pay for my food, the same person that scuffed at my earlier request looked dumbfounded and said to me "What?". I was told I could pay for my food after I ate, so I want to pay for my food. "Oh." I could have walked out of that place without even paying and probably would have been not been missed.

Yep, it's a solid 3 star.  I like trying the variety of food...some of the dishes I have never tried before...and will not know how to order in the future...but none of them truly stood out.  There are many filipino restaurants in las vegas, and I feel that they are all better:  DJ Bibingkahan, Ito'y Sariling Atin, and especially Elena's.  There was only fruit for dessert.  The price was reasonable, and the food decent.  I will however go back to Elena's.

Whenever I long for Filipino home cooking, I always end up at Nanay Gloria's.
The selections are plenty. The flavors are delicious. The price is under $10 per person (tax included.) And the most important thing....it's ALL YOU CAN EAT!!!
There's plenty of available seats inside the restaurant.
The menu selections at the buffet are amazing! Every time I eat at this place I discover dishes that I haven't tasted before. 
Let's face it....Filipino foods are heavy and rich...just the way I like it.
Among the dishes I love are: Bistek, kare-kare, dinuguan, mongo soup, tinolang manok, pork sisig, bopis, ginataan na jackfruit, kambing caldareta, and longanisa.
Notice that I avoided any rice, pancits, and starches in general....I'm watching my figure.
Kudos that they now take credit cards!
You get your money's worth at Nanay Gloria's!!!

Visiting from the bay and our friend highly recommend us to come here and try it and so we did. The food was good but some of the meat was hard. But what disappointed me was the service. I just wishes they were more friendlier and nicer. But other than that it was good.

I love going here for breakfast and lunch, mostly breakfast . Their longanisa is the best, along with the tocino. I was kind of flustered by the "cash only" part. They were nice enough to let me drive off and grab some cash. It's an overall good place for cheap eats. I seriously recommend breakfast. It's the best.

I'd give this Filipino buffet 3.5 stars.  It is better than okay, but I would not say that I am a fan of the place.  We frequent here if the whole family of in-laws are with us.  The price of the buffet is very affordable, and no one complains about the price.  They have many food choices such as pancit, adobo, lechon kawali, etc.  Everything tastes pretty good and fresh.

The place can get very crowded, especially if our family is there.  The seating is a bit crowded.  I recommend coming here if you are on a budget and want to eat some decent filipino food.

A woman at a local car rental place said that this was supposed to be one of the best in town and she was right - it was excellent.

Didn't have time to eat there, so got mongo beans and lechon to go. I'm probably the only person who was eating filipino food at the Valley of Fire State Park that day. It was GOOD. Crispy pork skin goodness. Lots of pork and bittermelon in the mongo. Yummy. It was hard to decide on just 2 things for combo takeout. Everything looked good.

It was full of people eating in groups. A good sign. Wish there was a place like that in Seattle. (Good quality, homemade-style Filipino food and lots of it.) For the price, it can't be beat.
